I came across an article today about a guy who's coworker turned down a bonus because it would "put him into the next tax bracket" :ctwokinds-keifacepalm:

I can't believe people still don't understand how their own taxes work.
lol, do bonuses not affect tax brackets?
The bonus would make him lose money? :thinking:
No, it's just not how tax brackets work.
You're only taxed on the money that puts you above the bracket.
I never had bonuses or whatnot never needed to mess with that kinda thing
And only on the money above the bracket.
Bonuses are withheld at a higher level, but you get that back with the return
AKA taxed at 25% at $50000, 10% at anything less. If you earn $50001, you pay $5000.25.
